description: Unknown. First appeared in Australia in the 1980s. Possibly in reference to supposedly unsophisticated people from remote outback places such as the Bogan River or Bogan Gate (cf. dubbo from Dubbo).

entries.meaning: (Australia, New Zealand, slang, derogatory stereotype) An unsophisticated person from a working class background.
(New Zealand, slang, derogatory) An Anglo-Celtic member of a lower socioeconomic group, stereotypically classified as wearing black jumpers or black concert T-shirts.

verbs.description: bogan (third-person singular simple present bogans, present participle boganning, simple past and past participle boganned)

description: Unknown. Perhaps a conflation of logan (from pokelogan) +â€Ž bog.

entries.meaning: (Canada) Any narrow water or creek, particularly a tranquil backwater.
(Canada, North Western Ontario, slang, derogatory, offensive) An indigenous person.
